Type.Name: MethodImplAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable MethodImplAttribute extends System.Attribute
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit MethodImplAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Specifies the details of how a method is implemented.

remarks.para: Compilers are required to not preserve this type in metadata as a custom attribute. Instead, compilers are required to emit it directly in the file format, as described in Partition II of the CLI Specification. Metadata consumers, such as the Reflection API, are required to retrieve this data from the file format and return it as if it were a custom attribute.

para.block: This class uses the enumeration to describe the implementation details of methods. For most languages, it is recommended that the notions of "forward" and "synchronized" be attached to methods using language syntax instead of custom attributes.

param.name: value
param.para: A that is interpreted as a bit-field that represents the desired value, which specifies a property of the method attributed by the current instance.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value interpreted as a value.

Docs.param: A value that specifies a property of the method attributed by the current instance.

summary.para: Gets the value describing the method attributed by the current instance.

value.para: The value describing the method attributed by the current instance.
